reviews.review_msg: Excellent instructor. Lectures and explains concepts well and with great clarity. He is very interested in the subject that he teaches, and he relates well with students. I appreciated how open-minded and easy going he is. His classes are a great platform for sharing and debating ideas. Pay attention in class and participate in every lecture.

Jakub is able to clearly and thoroughly present material in an engaging fashion and maintain an environment conducive to questions and discussion. He is receptive to student ideas and input and tries to minimize the hierarchy in the classroom setting. If you can take a course with Jakub, do it.
avoid them if you can, they are a tough grader and the extra words for feedback is so unnecessary. class lectures aren't even lectures as it is mostly discussion-based
This is a terrible course. If you don't agree with tutor/marker yo're in trouble. Took by dist. ed.--big mistake Avoid this one if you can
wicked preperation, great class

The fact that it is a distance ed. course makes it horrible. She is not to blame but the readings are confusing and bland. It would be better to take a course with her in person as opposed to distance ed.
She is a very hard marker. She has her views and marks against you if you do not agree with her views. I would not recommend to take any of her classes.

I took her 250/358 distance courses. There were small 1 page assignments (no final for 358); it's easy as long as you put in an effort. Base your assignments on the courseware, try and be as critical of the theories as possible. Participate in the forum. Great courses, easy marks.
Hard, unforgiving, and unclear.

I'm taking sociological theory online with Ann and find that she is a hard ass in her marking.  The 300 word count is ridiculous. She wants us to discuss in  depth and I do not think this is particularly possible. When I try to email her for help or suggestions, she uses a tone that is not welcoming.  You must share her view or else your toast.Gee!
Talks fast but is very clear, helpful and very supportive if you show you are really thinking.

Genuinely the worst professor I've had at SFU. Lectures are boring and confusing, she does not follow her own marking criteria (will take off marks for things she never outlined in her posted criteria), so you never know what she wants from you. Also inaccessible because she will brush you off when you try to question her about her marking. Avoid!

Debrorah is a really sweet woman and she tries her best to be a great prof. Her grading is pretty fair but there was a decent amount of work, since it was online we had to do discussion posts and blog posts almost everyweek - although she cancelled a lot this semester (summer 2020). I wouldn't say she is my favourite prof but I would take her again
Great class, 30 minute break after lectures and prior to tutorial was a life-saver. nom nom
Fantastic Prof.Clear, concise, and passionate. Would recommend!

One of the best profs I've ever had. I thought the course would be extremely dull, but Dom did a great job making it interesting and relatable to real-life. Come to class and do the work, and you will most likely get a good grade.

By far an above, best professor I've had in my 2 years at SFU. Shes always there to help, and will reply to emails within 4 hours after sending them. Her teaching methods always make the class interesting and relevant. Take this class!

Amazing prof! Loved her class. Test consisted of material from class notes or were take home which had direct answers from the books. Easy to understand and made the concepts fun to learn. As well was very flexible with office hours and help. Final exam questions were given in advance. An amazing prof!

Dom is amazing!! I was a bit nervous prior to taking her class this semester b/c she wasn't on this site, but I am SO glad that I did! She made Social Theory interesting and engaging by connecting it to real life and our own personal experiences. There are a lot of course components but not very difficult. Take this class with her. BEST PROF EVER!

There are a lot of writing assignments but if you can grasp the concepts and structure its easy to do well! This prof is great at providing feed back and was alway available if students had questions or to discuss upcoming assignments. There are a lot of readings but you only really need to read what youll be writing about.

Cynthia was great. She was soooo helpful, especially via email. A lot of these readings and assignments were very philosophical and she really helps break it down into more understandable topics. She wants her students to succeed and preaches that to her students.
Cynthia is a great prof! Shes very helpful with assignments if you take the time to email her or go see her. She corrects things in a way which makes you comprehend how to fix it.

Dr. Patton is the most respected professor I have ever had the privilege to take a course with. You can get a very high mark in her class if you put in the effort: she is a very forgiving grader and rewards effort. Beware that if you don't like reading and discussion, you won't like her class: there is no lecture, just group discussion in class.

She's a great prof. However, you won't make it if you don't have strong organizational skills and a strong motivation to succeed. If you have both, then you're bound to get a great mark. If you don't you'll probably regret taking her class. Seminars mainly consist of group discussion, so you absolutely need to do your research before class.

Go to class (pop quizs/assignments), show your respects and efforts! Its my second time taking course with Cindy, she is just awesome not just because of her grading style, but also my writing have actually improved! HIGHLY RECOMMEND *thumbs up

One of the best classes that I took because she actually cares about teaching her students. She did not test us nor expect us to memorize random and pointless information as many other profs do. Fair marker, lots of projects and readings. Everyone gets a chance to get an A in the class, only if they work hard for it. Would love to have her again.

Had a conversation yesterday with another student and realized I should really write this on here. Dany is the best prof you will ever have. She is incredibly intelligent, wants her students to do well and get the most out of the course that is possible. She covers theory (especially Foucault) in a way that you'll be able to recite it years later!

Dany is one of the best profs in the department and really wants her students to succeed, which I can't emphasize enough. I liked the way the class was structured and I particularly enjoyed reading about Marx, Durkheim, and Foucault. Dany knows the material so well by now that she can freestyle the entire lecture in an engaging manner.

Dr. Lacombe is very knowledgeable about sociology. In this class we discussed many of the important topics in sociology although we did not read any Weber and I think some of the thinkers we studied have highly debatable views. However, only one side of the debate is ever offered, which is dissapointing. She is passionate about Michel Fouccault.

Dany is a really great prof! She is very passionate about sociology and she makes the theory to life. Would definitely recommend her and hopefully I can get her for SA304. The tough is pretty tough overall, keep up with the readings and the key themes!

Very interesting class. Dany really brings the material to life and makes it very relevant to your personal existence. The readings are tough and you must do the, and I recommend going to class. Midterm was hard, hard marker and expects a lot. Class discussions were very interesting,I would recommend Dany!

She's a great lecturer, but she has no notes printed up. You have to go to every class or you fall behind. She's a tough marker and gets frustrated when people don't read the material (CCW: Foucault, Marx, etc). She's funny and extremely passionate about sociological theory; focussing very much on power dynamics and gender.
passionate teacher... very interesting course!! nice explanation on the course materials! need to pay attention to the themes and concepts of the text in class. she is very helpful too

Dany makes class very interesting to attend. Blunt when appropriate and lectures are always a pleasure. Will accommodate students to breaks when she feels the need. Very passionate about subject, even the tough theories are made easy to understand. Midterm was tough so she adjusted marks and made final easier. Few assignments, but reading A MUST!

If you're a third or fourth year student, this class will be a breeze - all theories have been taught in various social sciences.  2 quizes and one term paper make up 90% of the grade.  Dany was nice, but you really have to pay attention in class for themes - if you miss just one, your grade might be in jeopardy

Dany is not only an excellent teacher, but in the "right" way.The "deeper" learning occurs with a student being led to discovery instead of just telling. The material was difficult because it was jam packed with new ideas. Very different from what we're used to. IF YOU DO NOT LIKE READING OR WANT AN EASY COURSE DONT TAKE THIS.

Excellent prof. She makes going to class a delightful experience. Very engaging and delivers potentially boring material very effectively and makes complex theories interesting and accessible. Gives very detailed comments and is very passionate about her profession. Highly recommended course! Changes the way you think about society!

really really good class and Dany is really enthusiastic and she is an amazing teacher. The subject matter is also really interesting. Dany is also really open to discussion and I found that she really wanted us to do well on our tests, she asked us before hand how we wanted the test to be formatted
I really liked Dany's lectures, juicy material and a lot of information packed in there. Introduced me to many new concepts and theories. Would have liked less focus on group work, though

it was an interesting course, but lacombe has tricky multiple choice questions that screw you over, you get the impression she WANTS you to do bad. she is not very friendly during office hours and unresponsive to concerns and questions over email.
A feminist in every sense of the word. She articulates her points very well and is a great lecturer.

I would 100% recommend this course! Unfortunately, I wasn't able to attend any classes, but due to the kindness and accommodation shown by the professor, I was still able to do good in the class. I have never had a professor who has put this much love and care into the lectures, and in ensuring that the material is easy to understand.

Prof Underwood's class is the best one I have taken!! She knows so much about sociology, and she loves teaching, and is really accommodating to students with their personal needs for learning. Knows we have a life outside school. Can't say enough good things. Take her class!

Sol helps you connect sociology with the everyday life. The readings are sometimes hard to follow but Sol helps me to understand the main points. Very easy to ask questions if you are confused about expectations. I will take classes with Sol again!

Fantastic professor! I really can't recommend her enough. It is obvious she's passionate about sociology and teaching. She's super friendly and very easy to reach. I had no problem approaching her for help or even just to chat (which I really recommend!). A shame she isn't a permanent professor at SFU. Hoping I can take a class with her again!
i think this is a tough course but professor underwood is fair. she uses different styles so there is some lecture, lots of discussion and some videos each class. I recommend
Only 4 weeks in and Sol is by far my favorite prof at SFU!! So happy to teach sociology, and loves the students. I get excited to go to class every day.
